data.title: Board of Directors
data.text:
Chirag Patel

Board Chair, Americas

Organization: Penske

Email: chirag.patel@penske.com

Chirag has 20+ years of experience. His industry experience includes CPG, Hospitality, Finance, Technology and Logistics. Chirag has been with Penske for 15 years in various roles including IT and Engineering.

Chirag holds a Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering and a Master’s Degree in Computers & Info. Science from Cleveland State University.

Chirag is responsible for Penske’s DCC technologies including Planning and Dispatch Systems, Telematics and Mobile among others. Chirag has also presented and spoke at many OTM and Oracle conferences in past 6 years sharing valuable knowledge to the user community.

Outside work, Chirag enjoys family time, golf, tennis, movies, vegetable gardening and traveling.

Genevieve Collyn

Board Chair, EMEA/APAC

Organization: Kuehne + Nagel

Email: genevieve.collyn@kuehne-nagel.com

Genevieve has joined Kuehne & Nagel in 2000 in Belgium and was transferred to Luxembourg in 2005 where she supported the first Integrated Logistics OTM implementation. Since then she has been involved in many OTM implementation projects but also several release upgrades. Appointed in 2014 as Functional Process Owner she is now responsible for governance of the Integrated Logistics OTM instances.

She has been elected for the first time on the Board and is looking forward to sharing her experience to prepare the Conferences. In her spare time, she likes cooking and enjoys testing recipes from around the world.

Malcolm Goodfellow

Board Member, Americas

Organization: Integration Manager, RUAN Transportation

Email: mgoodfel@ruan.com

I've worked in the Supply Chain technology arena for 20 years at a major shipper and a 3PL provider. My history with OTM goes back to the GLOG days in 2004 Version 4.5. I have always worked in non-cloud solutions to this point and appreciate the trend of progress to cloud solutions. My focus on the application for most of my career has been towards the technical side of the product. I have transitioned more to the functional side in the last few years to broaden my horizons. The areas within the application I've focused on include integration, order management, planning and execution, track and track, freight settlement / billing and Fusion Transportation intelligence. A day cannot go by that you do not learn something new or identify another bug or enhancement in OTM. I've attended probably 10 OTM SIG conferences, and look forward to meeting new people and catching up with old friends at each year. The passion the user group has for solving problems and sharing ideas are what make the product, its users, and the yearly conference so great. As a board member for the last two years, I've come to understand how large the conference is from a coordination stand point, and appreciate the input of feedback on ideas on making things even better.

When outside of the world of OTM and supply chain solutions, I have a lovely wife and 8 year old twins. I love the mountains, hiking, camping, vegetable gardening, playing hockey, and also consider myself a “foodie”.

Ruchir Srivastava

Board Member, Americas

Organization: Starbucks

Email: rsrivast@starbucks.com

I have 19+ years of total logistics experience which spans across pre-sales, product development, consulting, program management and people management. I have been part of logistics solution implementations across various industries like CPG, 3PL, Oil & Gas, Retail, Life Sciences, Energy-Utilities, and manufacturing. During the course of these TMS journeys, I have leveraged OTM as a TMS solution for a variety of my customers.

I currently work for Starbucks as a Technology Product and Services Manager for Global Transportation. In this role I lead global transportation planning and execution from first mile to last mile within our transportation network, manage freight audit and pay for our carriers & provide trade compliance solutions for our shipping network.

In my free time I enjoy spending time with my family, playing sports and traveling.

Ryan Troutman

Board Member, Americas

Organization: Kuehne & Nagel

Email: ryan.troutman@kuehne-nagel.com

I’ve worked for Kuehne + Nagel for 10 years, all directly dealing with OTM (v5.5 - 6.4.3). I started in support, quickly moving to implementation and design. Most recently I am responsible for the oversight, governance and standardization of our OTM solutions throughout our regional teams (NAM/SAM, EU, APAC). I have been a regular attendee of the US SIG in Philadelphia and look forward to sharing/learning unique challenges and intriguing solutions each year. In my free time I enjoy working out, cooking, and spending time with my wife, daughter and two bulldogs.

Giovanni Lovo

Associate Board Member, EMEA/APAC

Organisation: Oracle

Email: giovanni.lovo@oracle.com

Giovanni Lovo leads for Oracle Consulting the EMEA OTM/GTM Practice which provides implementation services to customers in the Region.

Since November 2015 he has been an active member of the EMEA OTM SIG Board. He joined Oracle Consulting in 2000 as a project manager. Giovanni has been associated with G-Log since the acquisition by Oracle in 2006. He has contributed to the successful addition of GC3/OTM to the delivery footprint of Oracle Consulting in Europe, initially as a project manager and then from 2008 as the manager of the OTM European Practice. In this role he has established an extensive network with OTM/GTM Customers and Partners, contributing to the successful adoption of OTM/GTM in several client organizations.

Before joining Oracle in 2000 he worked as a consultant and project manager in the areas of supply chain management and computer systems validation. Giovanni holds a degree in Electronic Engineering and a Master in Business Administration. Giovanni is based in Milan (Italy)

Heather Brown

Associate Board Member, Americas

Organization: Freight Verify

Email: heather.brown@freightverify.com

Heather has been working in the Logistics space for over 20+ years, starting her career with Federal Express. Heather worked for Dow Chemical and General Motors and is currently working as the Lead OTM focal and Quality Assurance Manager for FreightVerify / Utilyze. She specializes in all modes of transport for both the Domestic and Intercontinental space. She has been a crucial member for two successful OTM implementations for Dow and GM, including the position as lead OTM focal for the GM/Freight Verify implementation.

She is a graduate from the University of Michigan and is currently pursuing her Master’s Degree from Central Michigan University in Information Systems Management.

Her hobbies include singing, as she is classically trained in Opera, cycling, and interior decorating. She also has a slight obsession with her cats.

Nikhil Gupta

Associate Board Member, EMEA/APAC

Organization: EY

Email: nikhilgupta.otm@gmail.com

Nikhil is a seasoned consultant and has been working in the Logistics applications space, since 2008. He has worked for clients across various industries including CPG, Manufacturing, QSR, Oil & Gas, LSPs, 3PL/4PLs, Food & Beverages, Retail etc.

In his current role at EY, Nikhil leads the Transportation Solutions Practice and handles client projects, globally. Responsibility also includes architecting OTM Solutions, handling Pre-Sales activities and managing innovative solutions and products for logistics practice, across EMEA and APAC regions. Nikhil has co-presented with multiple clients at OTM SIG conferences & has been a regular presenter in US, Amsterdam, Singapore, and India conferences, since 2012.

Nikhil is a computer science engineer and MBA Gold Medallist from the Centre for Development of Advanced Computing, India. He has also earned a certificate in Supply Chain Technologies from MIT, Massachusetts. Living in Bangalore, India with his family, Nikhil likes to spend time with his Son, write poetry, play table tennis and flute, in his spare time.
